name: Recruitment Process
body: This is a Sample project of a *Recruitment Process* at Exemplary Samples Co.

tasks.name: **New Candidate  Template**
tasks.body: To add a new candidate, just "Duplicate" this tab. Check additional options. [⋯]↗

discussions.name: Should we really hire someone with less than 5 years of experience as a senior?

comments.body: Olivia the HR Manager He has quite an unorthodox approach to problem solving. If this turns out to be his actual way of thinking, he would be an excellent addition to the team.

Fred the Head of HR Olivia the HR Manager I've checked his credentials and references. It seems that he is not only an excellent engineer, but exemplary colleague as well: most of people I talked to were very sorry to see him go.

Olivia the HR Manager I understand your concern, but at certain times you have to make an exception. Mr. Ramsey has proven to be quite an expert in the field, despite his relatively young age. To be honest, he is an excellent prospect for the future.

I started this discussion regarding one of our candidates, Phillip Ramsey. It seem he has 4 years of experience but we are considering hiring him as a senior developer.
Until Mr. Ramsey's case, the rule was 5 years of experience minimum for senior position.
What changed?

notes.name: About "Recruitment Process" project
notes.body:
Just a few pointers to get you started on our project. 
1. To add a new candidate, click on **New Candidate Template** and edit it.
2. Task title should bear the name of the candidate that applied for a certain position. 
3. Attach all files candidate provided when they applied (CV, motivational letter, etc.). 
4. Use labels to make their qualifications transparent (e.g. Senior Developer)  
5. Determine the number of phases you want the candidate to go through (in our case we like to keep it simple). Name tasks lists accordingly. 
6. Move each candidate (task) through task lists as their recruitment process progresses. 
7. Keep your "Applied" list packed with capable candidates at all time.
